definition: the natural opening through which food passes into the body of an animal and which in vertebrates is typically bounded externally by the lips and internally by the pharynx and encloses the tongue, gums, and teeth

voice, speech

something that resembles a mouth especially in affording entrance or exit: such as
the place where a stream enters a larger body of water

speak, pronounce

the place where a river enters the ocean
to say or repeat (something) without really meaning it or understanding it
to form (words) with your lips without speaking
the opening through which food passes into the body and which in humans is surrounded on the outside by the lips and contains the tongue and teeth

definition: the part of your face below your nose that you use to eat and speak. The corners of your mouth are the two outside ends of it, and the inside top part of your mouth is called the roof
if your mouth waters, it produces saliva  (=liquid) because you are about to eat something that you like

the entrance to something such as a cave  (=a hole in the side of a mountain) or tunnel
